transcript: ‚Äâ Supplements are NOT approved by the FDA before hitting store shelves. Unlike medications, companies don't have to prove they're safe or effective. ‚ùå Contamination with heavy metals ‚ùå Undeclared prescription drugs ‚ùå Wrong doses or fake ingredients ‚ùå Hidden stimulants or banned substances ‚ùóThis isn't rare ‚Äî it's happening right now in products you can buy at Walmart, Amazon, or GNC. Ephedra (Ma Huang) ‚Äì Connected to over 100 deaths, finally banned in 2004. Kratom ‚Äì Still legal, despite causing addiction and fatal overdoses. ARIIX Rejuveniix ‚Äì Contained hidden pharmaceutical drugs. These were all sold legally until people got hurt. ‚ùóJust because it's on a store shelf doesn't mean it's safe. Here's how to stay safe: Look for THIRD-PARTY TESTING. Since the FDA doesn't regulate supplements for safety, third-party testing is your only real way to know: ‚úÖ What's actually in the bottle ‚úÖ That it doesn't contain harmful contaminants ‚úÖ That the dose matches the label ‚úÖ That it's free from banned or hidden substances Trusted Third-Party Seals to Look For: NSF Certified for Sport USP Verified ConsumerLab Informed Choice If your supplement doesn't have any of these? Do your homework, ask questions, and only buy products that are third-party tested. transcript: ‚Äâ At 15 I was exactly the same. I didn't like being called nor perceived as a girl, I liked boyish things but I didn't want to be trans nor a boy. At the time I just said to myself "whatever I'll figure it out later" and went for a gnc girl for a while. Eventually I realised I'm gender fluid - but **I** have moments in which I feel like I don't dislike being a girl and moments in which I wished I didn't have breast and so on. But that's me. From what you wrote your feelings seem constant. So 1. don't rush things, take your time. It's gonna all come together with time. 2. You might be some shade of NB (maybe demigender, or idk, pick your label), you might be simply gnc because you don't want to be like the other girls (for example ever since I was a kid I was scared of being sexualised. So I dressed up as a boy to be perceived as one because I did understand unconsciously that boys weren't), or you might remain unlabeled! "what gender are you?" "no." it frees your mind, sometimes, not to fit in any box. 3. explore yourself, try asking your friends or someone you feel safe with to try to call you with he/him, they/them or other sets of pronouns, try dressing differently, try another name, if you feel like yours doesn't fit you! Do it as long as you discover yourself fully and you feel comfortable. Don't push yourself over the limits just to test it. Be true to yourself and your feelings.

Eventually I realised I'm gender fluid - but **I** have moments in which I feel like I don't dislike being a girl and moments in which I wished I didn't have breast and so on. But that's me. From what you wrote your feelings seem constant. So 1. don't rush things, take your time. It's gonna all come together with time. 2. You might be some shade of NB (maybe demigender, or idk, pick your label), you might be simply gnc because you don't want to be like the other girls (for example ever since I was a kid I was scared of being sexualised. "no." it frees your mind, sometimes, not to fit in any box. 3. explore yourself, try asking your friends or someone you feel safe with to try to call you with he/him, they/them or other sets of pronouns, try dressing differently, try another name, if you feel like yours doesn't fit you! Do it as long as you discover yourself fully and you feel comfortable. Don't push yourself over the limits just to test it. Be true to yourself and your feelings.

transcript: ‚Äâ Just wondering! I'm (22 NB) also an early intervention RBT at the moment as a preservice upper elementary teacher (3-6 all subjects, K-8 sciences and CS/tech). I don't lean SUPER hard into masculinity at the moment (because I'm, quite frankly, a bit scared to) and have been forced into femininity my entire life that feels like armor but also like a Halloween costume (protective, fun to wear occasionally, but all-around feels fake and performative on me). I definitely feel my gender identity is influenced by my neurodivergence. People usually incorrectly assume my gender identity as being a woman since I'm still building a more masculine wardrobe and I'm shorter, rounder, and have a larger chest. Working with younger kids, I find that I feel very alone since many of the people I'm surrounded by are mostly pretty feminine, nor do I feel very accepted with the guys I work with either. They just kind of lump me in with the women, which I sometimes find frustrating. I don't have a place where I feel I ‚Äúfit in‚Äù and often don't feel ‚Äúallowed‚Äù to be nonbinary in my profession working with kids who might be labeled as ‚Äútoo young to understand gender identity,‚Äù especially considering the current political climate, as well as my workplace's use of assessments and programming for clients that only use they/them as a plural pronoun. I don't  want to confuse them while they're still learning. I'm in a more conservative-leaning area. Many of my coworkers are queer, but no others are nonbinary or really GNC in any way. Just looking to feel less alone, vent a lil, maybe some advice, and wondering if there's any more of us out there!
cleaned_transcript: Just wondering! I'm (22 NB) also an early intervention RBT at the moment as a preservice upper elementary teacher (3-6 all subjects, K-8 sciences and CS/tech). I don't lean SUPER hard into masculinity at the moment (because I'm, quite frankly, a bit scared to) and have been forced into femininity my entire life that feels like armor but also like a Halloween costume (protective, fun to wear occasionally, but all-around feels fake and performative on me). I definitely feel my gender identity is influenced by my neurodivergence. People usually incorrectly assume my gender identity as being a woman since I'm still building a more masculine wardrobe and I'm shorter, rounder, and have a larger chest. Working with younger kids, I find that I feel very alone since many of the people I'm surrounded by are mostly pretty feminine, nor do I feel very accepted with the guys I work with either. They just kind of lump me in with the women, which I sometimes find frustrating. I don't have a place where I feel I ‚Äúfit in‚Äù and often don't feel ‚Äúallowed‚Äù to be nonbinary in my profession working with kids who might be labeled as ‚Äútoo young to understand gender identity,‚Äù especially considering the current political climate, as well as my workplace's use of assessments and programming for clients that only use they/them as a plural pronoun. I don't want to confuse them while they're still learning. I'm in a more conservative-leaning area. Many of my coworkers are queer, but no others are nonbinary or really GNC in any way. Just looking to feel less alone, vent a lil, maybe some advice, and wondering if there's any more of us out there!
reasoning: The comment is a personal narrative about gender identity and workplace experiences, with no mention of GNC (General Nutrition Center) supplements, products, or brand-related content. The text does not discuss gym supplements or provide any insights relevant to the GNC brand.

transcript: ‚Äâ Classified in: Health Subject: PDT SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media Contact: Angela Brooks 2015035854 [email¬†protected] SOURCE Mira's Harvest News published on 3 july 2025 at 08:42 and distributed by

Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year.

Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. transcript: ‚Äâ SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Tambi√©n se registraron cortes de luz. > Hubo tres encuentros en menos de 24 horas del Comit√© Ejecutivo de **Emergencia** que re√∫ne al Ente Nacional Regulador del Gas (**Enargas**) junto a empresas transportistas y distribuidoras, [tal como cont√≥ **Infobae** en exclusiva](https://www.infobae.com/economia/2025/07/02/emergencia-por-el-gas-extienden-cortes-a-industrias-limitan-el-uso-de-gnc-y-restringen-envios-a-chile-por-la-ola-de-frio/ "https://www.infobae.com/economia/2025/07/02/emergencia-por-el-gas-extienden-cortes-a-industrias-limitan-el-uso-de-gnc-y-restringen-envios-a-chile-por-la-ola-de-frio/"). > Las medidas que se tomaron para garantizar el abastecimiento prioritario de los hogares incluyeron la interrupci√≥n del suministro de **gas** en **industrias** ‚Äîincluidas algunas que tienen contratos firmes‚Äî, lo mismo por 24 horas en estaciones de GNC y la restricci√≥n parcial de las **exportaciones de fluido a Chile**. transcript: ‚Äâ Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules ‚ÄúPartnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,‚Äù said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. ‚ÄúThey're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.‚Äù Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats‚Äîfrom resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. transcript: ‚Äâ Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules ‚ÄúPartnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,‚Äù said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. ‚ÄúThey're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.‚Äù Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats‚Äîfrom resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules ‚ÄúPartnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,‚Äù said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. ‚ÄúThey're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.‚Äù Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats‚Äîfrom resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. Contact Information: Contact Person's Name: Akash Dhoot Organization / Company: BetterAlt Company website: thebetteralt.com Contact Email Address: press.com City, State / Province, Country, Zip Code: Dover, Delaware, 19904 A photo accompanying this announcement is available at
reasoning: The press release mentions GNC as one of the major retailers carrying BetterAlt's products, which are health and nutrition supplements aligned with GNC's category of gym and wellness supplements. The content is directly related to the brand's product distribution and market presence.

transcript: ‚Äâ Off Tirz after loosing 35lbs in 6 weeks. 220lbs to 185lbs wanted to see what the hype was with Reta even though I'm almost at my goal weight of 170 lbs. Just started Reta a few weeks ago current stack is Reta 1mg  1x week CCJ/ipa 500mcg daily before bed AOD 500mcg daily morning or before workout Tesofensine 500mcg tablet AM daily KLOW 4-6 mg 2-3 X daily MT2 250-500mcg weekly maintenance It's ALOT of pinning and rotating injection sites Running 20+ miles weekly Weight training 3-5 days Current diet is 10oz meals I buy 50 packs of 12oz food prep containers off Amazon. They're really small. Usually make 15 to 20 meals for the week for the wife and I. 1x eggs bacons sausage potatoes bell peppers 2x Brown rice, meat protein, broccoli, yams 2x protein BCAA 1x GNC mega men whole body multivitamins 1 gal water daily 4 LMNT packets or just pink salt and lemon.

transcript: ‚Äâ BetterAlt's latest retail expansion is placing its Ayurvedic-inspired wellness products in 425 Sprouts Farmers Market locations across the U.S., reinforcing consumer demand for natural supplements that combine traditional remedies with modern science-backed formulations. Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: ‚ÄúPartnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,‚Äù said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. ‚ÄúThey're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.‚Äù Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats‚Äîfrom resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. Contact Information: Contact Person's Name: Akash Dhoot Organization / Company: BetterAlt Company website: thebetteralt.com Contact Email Address: press@thebetteralt.com City, State / Province, Country, Zip Code: Dover, Delaware, 19904 A photo accompanying this announcement is available at https://www.globenewswire.com/NewsRoom/AttachmentNg/cd3d37a7-ebf7-48fd-b0f4-d1932aa8fa6d

transcript: ‚Äâ BetterAlt's latest retail expansion is placing its Ayurvedic-inspired wellness products in 425 Sprouts Farmers Market locations across the U.S., reinforcing consumer demand for natural supplements that combine traditional remedies with modern science-backed formulations. Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules ‚ÄúPartnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,‚Äù said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. ‚ÄúThey're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.‚Äù Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats‚Äîfrom resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. transcript: ‚Äâ I completely agree with everyone's comments. When I got the new packaging, I thought it was just cosmetic. It turns out that it doesn't mix worth a dam, the sediment that is left is literally salt (I have chewed the leftover pieces and they are absolutely coarse salt), and the flavor is much worse. I can only tolerate chocolate flavored shakes, but I don't think the other flavors will be any different. I have had an Amazon subscription for isopure for a couple of years now, which I have since canceled. I'm returning my last container. My focus is carbohydrates. Isopure had a net zero carb for the chocolate flavor, which was fantastic. The closest match I have found is from GNC advanced muscle performance pure isolate chocolate lava cake. It has only two net carbs and only 15 more calories per serving, which is the best I can find so far. I did see isopure unflavored, which has zero carbs and lower calories. I haven't tried it yet. If I can't choke it down, I'm going to have to go with the pure isolate from GNC. I don't want to do that, because it's more calories, carbs, and is noticeably more expensive. Does anyone know how we can provide feedback directly to the company?

transcript: ‚Äâ I'll post a longer review on my 8 days in Mexico City but here are my overall thoughts: Culture/History: Amazing. So many things to see and do. If you are a history nerd you will get lost in all the knowledge there is. Do the pyramids, Palacio Nacional, Leon Trotsky House, etc. Food: Meh. The food was honestly mid asf. I've had better tacos in LA and Tijuana. I honestly can't say I had a good taco here. The pirata and gringas from Orinoco were really good. I also had some really good mole from Los Danzantes in Coyoacan. CDMX has cute cafes with good teas and pan dulce and sandwiches everywhere. I had good sandwiches (they call them baguettes) from Odette and Pasteleria Esperanza. Food is better in Tijuana and Oaxaca. People: Meh. I've met way friendlier people in TJ and Oaxaca. Here people are a little standoffish and on edge. I hate talking to Uber drivers but here trying to get an Uber driver to talk to you was like pulling teeth out of a dog. I did meet some nice people but they were all in Coyoacan. In Roma/Condesa/Zona Rosa/Reforma ppl were not really nice and I heard this from other people too. Most of the people that I vibed with were not from Mexico City. I met some cool people from Colombia, Brazil, and other parts of Mexico (Sinaloa, Jalisco) but didn't really make any connections with Chilangos. You could really feel the gringo fatigue. Safety: The city is surprisingly safe. I did not ever feel out of place or unsafe. I am not sure what everyone is so scared of. I used the metro, metrobus, and the combis to get around town. Never ever felt unsafe, I also never saw a pickpocket on the subway or in centro. Nightlife: Horrible. People just sit around and drink in small spaces. There is very little dancing. I came here expecting to dance but people just sit around tables with cubetas and talk or listen to someone sing karaoke. It was extremely underwhelming, I was expecting to stay out every night until 7am and I only went out once. One night I just decided to go back to sleep because it was so lame. Also the city shuts down pretty early by 10pm or sometimes earlier everything is closed. Also the drinks here are weak asf, this is something multiple people agreed with me on. I ordered a Long Island and it's literally supposed to have just a touch of coke‚Ä¶why did the bartender pour half the bottle?? This is something I wanted to add: STARES: I have never been stared at so much in my life. At first it didn't annoy me because I know it's socially acceptable to stare in Mexico but by the end of my trip I was annoyed especially because I am not white, my family is from Mexico. I don't know what that was about at all and it actually pissed me off. I have also never experienced stares like this in TJ or Oaxaca. RACISM: No one wants to talk about how racist this city is. I was followed and racially profiled while buying laundry detergent at a Walmart in Condesa, I didn't even know that was supposed to be a rich neighborhood. It looked ghetto and rundown. I actually thought I was going to get mugged while walking to it but when I got inside I was the only brown person shopping in the store and the security guard decided to become my personal shopping assistantüôÑ I also think that's where the stares came from. I could sense that people could feel uncomfortable by my skin colorüòí I could write more on this but whatever. They've never seen a rich successful brown person like me PRIDE: Pride was HORRIBLE. If you don't reserve a table or get a ticket to a bar/club weeks in advance you will be standing in a line outside of the club for hours....

transcript: ‚Äâ Imagine a world where premium natural health products are accessible to anyone, anywhere, with a single click. For millions worldwide, this isn't a fantasy‚Äîit's the reality created by iHerb Health Innovations . Since its inception, this trailblazing company has transformed how consumers access scientifically-backed wellness solutions, emerging as the undisputed leader in global supplement distribution. With an uncompromising commitment to quality, technological ingenuity, and consumer trust, iHerb has redefined industry standards while connecting over 50,000 premium products to customers in 185 countries. Their journey from a California garage startup to a $2.5 billion global powerhouse reflects a seismic shift in how the world approaches holistic health . The Rise of iHerb Health Innovations: From Humble Beginnings to Global Leader iHerb Health Innovations began in 1996 when founder Ron Williams transformed his personal quest for quality supplements into a mission to democratize wellness. Operating from a 500-square-foot office in California, the company pioneered early e-commerce innovations when online shopping was still nascent. A pivotal milestone came in 2000 with the launch of their proprietary inventory system, enabling unprecedented shipping speeds‚Äîa game-changer when competitors took weeks. By 2010, iHerb had expanded to 30 countries, supported by multilingual customer service that established trust across diverse markets. The 2015 introduction of their AI-driven recommendation engine marked another leap forward, personalizing supplement discovery for millions. Global recognition accelerated when iHerb became the first supplement retailer to achieve ISO/IEC 27001 certification for data security in 2018, coinciding with warehouse expansions in South Korea and Europe. Today, processing over 45,000 daily orders, iHerb's market position leverages blockchain technology for supply chain transparency‚Äîallowing customers to trace every product from manufacturer to doorstep. This operational excellence, combined with partnerships with 1,500+ brands like NOW Foods and California Gold Nutrition, cemented iHerb's evolution from niche retailer to essential health infrastructure. Revolutionizing Wellness: iHerb's Game-Changing Product Ecosystem iHerb product offerings represent a curated revolution in natural health. Their proprietary brands‚Äîlike low-toxicity skincare line Earth's Splendor and athlete-focused Sports Research‚Äîexemplify rigorous standards, with 30% developed based on customer data insights. Flagship innovations include the 2022 launch of microbiome testing kits synced to personalized probiotic regimens, a concept later adopted industry-wide. Their ‚ÄúSupplement Stack Builder‚Äù tool, integrated with wearable health data, allows users to scientifically customize combinations‚Äîaddressing specific needs like menopause support or athletic recovery. The impact on consumer behavior is measurable: iHerb's transparency reports showing third-party lab results for every batch drove a 62% industry-wide increase in demand for certificate-of-analysis documentation between 2019-2023. Their best-selling products, such as liposomal vitamin C and full-spectrum CBD oils, frequently catalyze market shifts; when iHerb expanded its vegan protein selection by 300% in 2020, competitors followed suit within 18 months. By making pharmaceutical-grade supplements like Thorne Research accessible globally at 20-30% below market rates, they've disrupted traditional pricing models while maintaining uncompromising quality‚Äîverified by their industry-leading 4.9/5 average review score across 6 million+ evaluations. Technological Frontiers: iHerb's Innovation Engine iHerb innovation extends far beyond e-commerce into cutting-edge health tech. Their 2021 patent for stabilized probiotic encapsulation ensures live cultures survive stomach acid‚Äîincreasing efficacy by 400% compared to standard supplements. Collaborations with research institutions like UCLA's Center for Human Nutrition have yielded proprietary formulations like ‚ÄúNeuroFuel,‚Äù a nootropic blend clinically shown to enhance cognitive function. The company's R&D hub in Austin, Texas, employs 70 scientists dedicated to bioavailability enhancement, using technologies like nano-emulsification to maximize nutrient absorption. A landmark achievement came with their AI-powered ‚ÄúHealth Insights Platform,‚Äù which analyzes user reviews, symptom patterns, and clinical research to predict emerging health trends. This tool identified the adaptogen ashwagandha's sleep-enhancing potential 18 months before it became a mainstream staple. Additionally, iHerb's blockchain initiative‚Äîdeveloped with IBM Food Trust‚Äîprovides immutable records of every product's journey, from soil testing at organic farms to temperature-controlled transit. This fusion of iHerb technology and wellness science positions them not just as retailers, but as architects of supplement innovation's future. Global Domination: Strategic Expansion and Market Influence iHerb worldwide presence reflects meticulously engineered localization. Rather than blanket globalization, they pursue hyper-localized strategies: In Japan, offerings emphasize marine collagen and matcha-based supplements aligned with cultural preferences, while Middle Eastern hubs feature vitamin D3 formulations tailored to sun-deprived regions. Their 2019 partnership with China's JD.com enabled tariff-optimized distribution, capturing 40% of the cross-border supplement market within two years. Acquisitions like the 2020 purchase of European logistics provider HealthPriority accelerated same-day delivery across Germany and France. iHerb market expansion into emerging economies includes ‚ÄúWellness Hubs‚Äù‚Äîphysical kiosks in Southeast Asia where rural customers access tele-nutritionists via iHerb tablets. These hubs increased first-time supplement users by 200% in Indonesia and the Philippines. Crucially, their compliance engine navigates 185 regulatory environments, automatically reformulating products to meet local standards‚Äîsuch as Australia's TGA guidelines or the EU's Novel Food regulations. This sophisticated framework supports their operations in global health markets. Cultivating Trust: iHerb's Consumer Loyalty Blueprint iHerb customer loyalty stems from an obsessive focus on experience. Their ‚Äú360-Degree Guarantee‚Äù combines price matching, 365-day returns, and live chat support with accredited nutritionists‚Äîa model that reduced customer churn by 33%. When supply chain disruptions hit in 2021, iHerb's real-time inventory dashboard allowed users to track delays, maintaining 92% satisfaction rates while competitors plummeted. Community-building initiatives like user-generated ‚ÄúRegimen Journals‚Äù foster peer validation, with shared success stories driving 40% of new customer acquisitions. This trust translates into tangible industry authority: iHerb consistently ranks #1 in ConsumerLab's supplement retailer surveys for authenticity, beating Amazon and GNC. Their review system‚Äîrequiring verified purchase documentation‚Äîhas become the gold standard, cited in studies by institutions like the National Institutes of Health. This iHerb brand reputation as a transparent intermediary makes them the preferred partner for clinical researchers; Johns Hopkins' 2023 micronutrient study exclusively sourced supplements through iHerb to ensure batch consistency. Since its inception, this trailblazing company has transformed how consumers access scientifically-backed wellness solutions, emerging as the undisputed leader in global supplement distribution. With an uncompromising commitment to quality, technological ingenuity, and consumer trust, iHerb has redefined industry standards while connecting over 50,000 premium products to customers in 185 countries. Their journey from a California garage startup to a $2.5 billion global powerhouse reflects a seismic shift in how the world approaches holistic health . The Rise of iHerb Health Innovations: From Humble Beginnings to Global Leader iHerb Health Innovations began in 1996 when founder Ron Williams transformed his personal quest for quality supplements into a mission to democratize wellness. Operating from a 500-square-foot office in California, the company pioneered early e-commerce innovations when online shopping was still nascent. A pivotal milestone came in 2000 with the launch of their proprietary inventory system, enabling unprecedented shipping speeds‚Äîa game-changer when competitors took weeks. By 2010, iHerb had expanded to 30 countries, supported by multilingual customer service that established trust across diverse markets. The 2015 introduction of their AI-driven recommendation engine marked another leap forward, personalizing supplement discovery for millions. Global recognition accelerated when iHerb became the first supplement retailer to achieve ISO/IEC 27001 certification for data security in 2018, coinciding with warehouse expansions in South Korea and Europe. Today, processing over 45,000 daily orders, iHerb's market position leverages blockchain technology for supply chain transparency‚Äîallowing customers to trace every product from manufacturer to doorstep. This operational excellence, combined with partnerships with 1,500+ brands like NOW Foods and California Gold Nutrition, cemented iHerb's evolution from niche retailer to essential health infrastructure. Revolutionizing Wellness: iHerb's Game-Changing Product Ecosystem iHerb product offerings represent a curated revolution in natural health. Their proprietary brands‚Äîlike low-toxicity skincare line Earth's Splendor and athlete-focused Sports Research‚Äîexemplify rigorous standards, with 30% developed based on customer data insights. Flagship innovations include the 2022 launch of microbiome testing kits synced to personalized probiotic regimens, a concept later adopted industry-wide. Their ‚ÄúSupplement Stack Builder‚Äù tool, integrated with wearable health data, allows users to scientifically customize combinations‚Äîaddressing specific needs like menopause support or athletic recovery. The impact on consumer behavior is measurable: iHerb's transparency reports showing third-party lab results for every batch drove a 62% industry-wide increase in demand for certificate-of-analysis documentation between 2019-2023. Their best-selling products, such as liposomal vitamin C and full-spectrum CBD oils, frequently catalyze market shifts; when iHerb expanded its vegan protein selection by 300% in 2020, competitors followed suit within 18 months. By making pharmaceutical-grade supplements like Thorne Research accessible globally at 20-30% below market rates, they've disrupted traditional pricing models while maintaining uncompromising quality‚Äîverified by their industry-leading 4.9/5 average review score across 6 million+ evaluations. Technological Frontiers: iHerb's Innovation Engine iHerb innovation extends far beyond e-commerce into cutting-edge health tech. Their 2021 patent for stabilized probiotic encapsulation ensures live cultures survive stomach acid‚Äîincreasing efficacy by 400% compared to standard supplements. Collaborations with research institutions like UCLA's Center for Human Nutrition have yielded proprietary formulations like ‚ÄúNeuroFuel,‚Äù a nootropic blend clinically shown to enhance cognitive function. The company's R&D hub in Austin, Texas, employs 70 scientists dedicated to bioavailability enhancement, using technologies like nano-emulsification to maximize nutrient absorption. A landmark achievement came with their AI-powered ‚ÄúHealth Insights Platform,‚Äù which analyzes user reviews, symptom patterns, and clinical research to predict emerging health trends. This tool identified the adaptogen ashwagandha's sleep-enhancing potential 18 months before it became a mainstream staple. Additionally, iHerb's blockchain initiative‚Äîdeveloped with IBM Food Trust‚Äîprovides immutable records of every product's journey, from soil testing at organic farms to temperature-controlled transit. This fusion of iHerb technology and wellness science positions them not just as retailers, but as architects of supplement innovation's future. Global Domination: Strategic Expansion and Market Influence iHerb worldwide presence reflects meticulously engineered localization. Rather than blanket globalization, they pursue hyper-localized strategies: In Japan, offerings emphasize marine collagen and matcha-based supplements aligned with cultural preferences, while Middle Eastern hubs feature vitamin D3 formulations tailored to sun-deprived regions. Their 2019 partnership with China's JD.com enabled tariff-optimized distribution, capturing 40% of the cross-border supplement market within two years. Acquisitions like the 2020 purchase of European logistics provider HealthPriority accelerated same-day delivery across Germany and France. iHerb market expansion into emerging economies includes ‚ÄúWellness Hubs‚Äù‚Äîphysical kiosks in Southeast Asia where rural customers access tele-nutritionists via iHerb tablets. These hubs increased first-time supplement users by 200% in Indonesia and the Philippines. Crucially, their compliance engine navigates 185 regulatory environments, automatically reformulating products to meet local standards‚Äîsuch as Australia's TGA guidelines or the EU's Novel Food regulations. This sophisticated framework supports their operations in global health markets. Cultivating Trust: iHerb's Consumer Loyalty Blueprint iHerb customer loyalty stems from an obsessive focus on experience. Their ‚Äú360-Degree Guarantee‚Äù combines price matching, 365-day returns, and live chat support with accredited nutritionists‚Äîa model that reduced customer churn by 33%. When supply chain disruptions hit in 2021, iHerb's real-time inventory dashboard allowed users to track delays, maintaining 92% satisfaction rates while competitors plummeted. Community-building initiatives like user-generated ‚ÄúRegimen Journals‚Äù foster peer validation, with shared success stories driving 40% of new customer acquisitions. This trust translates into tangible industry authority: iHerb consistently ranks in ConsumerLab's supplement retailer surveys for authenticity, beating Amazon and GNC. Their review system‚Äîrequiring verified purchase documentation‚Äîhas become the gold standard, cited in studies by institutions like the National Institutes of Health. This iHerb brand reputation as a transparent intermediary makes them the preferred partner for clinical researchers; Johns Hopkins' 2023 micronutrient study exclusively sourced supplements through iHerb to ensure batch consistency. Building software for a rocket is an incredibly complex and critical endeavor! It requires extreme precision, reliability, and fault tolerance. Unlike a garage parking system, even a tiny bug can have catastrophic consequences. Blueprint for Rocket Software     Here's a blueprint for the software side of a rocket, outlining the key systems and considerations. 1. System Overview     The rocket software is the brain of the entire mission, responsible for controlling every aspect from liftoff to payload deployment and, for reusable rockets, landing. It must operate in real-time, handle vast amounts of sensor data, make critical decisions, and communicate flawlessly with ground control and various onboard systems. 2. Core Software Subsystems    2.1. Flight Control System (FCS)     Description: The heart of the rocket's navigation and guidance. This system ensures the rocket stays on its intended trajectory. Key Responsibilities:  Guidance: Determines the desired trajectory and current position/velocity. Calculates the necessary changes (delta-V) to reach the target. This often involves complex algorithms like Kalman filters for state estimation and optimal control theory. Navigation: Uses sensor data (IMUs, GPS, star trackers) to precisely determine the rocket's current position, velocity, and attitude. Control: Translates guidance commands into physical actuator movements (e.g., gimbaling engine nozzles, adjusting fin deflections). transcript: ‚Äâ I'm really late to this but me and my bf are obsessed tbh. He was on and on about this and I was super against it because I thought it was expensive and stupid. He got the ribeye and brisket. I tried it and went fucking wild. I loved it so much I literally thought about it all day the next day at work, and ordered more. Then the new box came it felt like that SpongeBob episode where squidward didn't want to try the krabby patty and started obsessing, and SpongeBob caught him and he locked himself in the vault lol. The only thing that stops us from ordering more is the fact we can't afford it. And I hate ordering from websites / paying for shipping. I DO understand why the price is what it is now. Not because of just how good it is but like. . it's a fucking ribeye. I know there's a tj dillashaw version that just came out and for example it's a 20oz ribeye‚Ä¶ like. . a 12oz ribeye where I'm at is around $16-20+ Let alone a 20oz ribeye, plus the cost and labor of it being sliced, cured, commercial packaging, websites, employees, etc. like it all actually makes sense when you look at it from that angle. I actually only found this post because I'm trying to find an easily accessible dupe lol. I'm looking into a dehydrator on prime day and the tj dillashaw brand ones because apparently they're on Amazon, and at some sprouts and gnc and again, I'm going for convenience. If I have to wait a week for them to arrive I also have to consider buying more than one because I won't want to order again for a while and shipping is like $6 + unless you're spending like $200. Which I am priced out of the free shipping market lol. When I get tipped well from a client I'd like to swing by sprouts or gnc or somewhere local and buy a bag to bring home, and treat me and my bf like you would by grabbing dinner or some wine for example, but the ordering online part makes that hard. Anyways. Definitely recommend x10000. They're meant to be refrigerated after opening since I saw someone said it's gonna go rancid. They're meant to be eaten in about a week but we did stretch one bag once to about 2 weeks as we went out of town and forgot about them, they seemed fine and we still enjoyed them. We've tried a few, and the best were the ribeye and brisket as well as the wagyu but that ones members only so you have to keep an eye out or join the email list and every once and a while they'll drop it for everyone for a day. The ribeye is special and a 10/10 but me and my boyfriend agreed the brisket for whatever reason is ‚Ä¶ almost exactly the same. It's maybe like 5% less good, if that, but I'd like $8/9 cheaper something like that. So we normally buy brisket now so we can save a little. Idk why it's so fucking good and similar to the ribeye but it is. The wagyu speaks for itself. they're all like crispy, but literally melt in your mouth. We have had a few other cuts and they were GOOD but wouldn't get again since we know how good these two are. The others weren't AS like melt in your mouth and had more. . I don't want to say chew but more ‚Ä¶ grit? Idk. Absolutely try

When I get tipped well from a client I'd like to swing by sprouts or gnc or somewhere local and buy a bag to bring home, and treat me and my bf like you would by grabbing dinner or some wine for example, but the ordering online part makes that hard. Anyways. Definitely recommend x10000. They're meant to be refrigerated after opening since I saw someone said it's gonna go rancid. They're meant to be eaten in about a week but we did stretch one bag once to about 2 weeks as we went out of town and forgot about them, they seemed fine and we still enjoyed them. We've tried a few, and the best were the ribeye and brisket as well as the wagyu but that ones members only so you have to keep an eye out or join the email list and every once and a while they'll drop it for everyone for a day. The ribeye is special and a 10/10 but me and my boyfriend agreed the brisket for whatever reason is ‚Ä¶ almost exactly the same. It's maybe like 5% less good, if that, but I'd like $8/9 cheaper something like that. So we normally buy brisket now so we can save a little. Idk why it's so fucking good and similar to the ribeye but it is. The wagyu speaks for itself. they're all like crispy, but literally melt in your mouth. We have had a few other cuts and they were GOOD but wouldn't get again since we know how good these two are. The others weren't AS like melt in your mouth and had more. . I don't want to say chew but more ‚Ä¶ grit? Idk. Absolutely try
